name: Jump Oriented Programming (JOP)
description:
Jump Oriented Programming (JOP) is an exploit technique used by attackers to bypass Data Execution Prevention (DEP/NX) as well as other potential mitigations such as Supervisor Mode Access Prevention (SMAP).

The idea is fundamentally similar to Return Oriented Programming (ROP), however gadgets end with a jmp instruction rather than a ret instruction. Gadgets are much more limited for JOP, as the attacker must be able to control where the gadget jmp's to, typically via a dispatch table.

It can be used in kernel exploitation to defeat anti-ROP mitigations and execute arbitrary code.
